previewParagraphs: Both Cremonese and Cagliari head into their battle at the Stadio Giovanni Zini with aspirations of moving up the Serie A table and putting recent inconsistency behind them. This meeting pits two teams with similar struggles and strengths, with little separating them on paper throughout the season.

The last time these sides met, Cagliari narrowly edged Cremonese in Sardinia, with a 1-0 victory coming courtesy of Gianluca Lapadula’s finish. Cremonese actually enjoyed a slight edge in ball possession at 51% and created more shots on target – six compared to Cagliari’s four. However, Cagliari looked more threatening in dangerous attacks, tallying 65 to Cremonese’s 33, and ultimately converted that superiority into three points just past the hour mark.

If history is any indicator, tight margins can be expected once again. The two clubs remain neck-and-neck in the league table. Cremonese are 13th with 5 wins, 6 draws, and 7 losses, scoring 18 and conceding 21 in their 18 matches. Cagliari sit right behind in 14th, having won 4, drawn 6, and lost 8, with 19 goals for and 25 against.

Cremonese’s record at home reveals both promise and issues. They have tasted defeat in 3 of their last 6 home fixtures and only kept clean sheets in 42% of their last 12 at Stadio Giovanni Zini. Remarkably though, Cremonese haven’t been defeated in 82% of their last 22 home games and drawn half of those, indicating just how often points are shared here. Still, they haven’t won in 8 of their last 10 home matches.

On the other hand, Cagliari’s away form leaves much to be desired. Winless in 10 of their last 12 away matches, and losing 50% of those, Cagliari have also struggled to claim maximum points on the road. In the broader context, they are winless in 13 of their last 15 games in all competitions, a spell which highlights their struggle for consistency.

When examining recent performances, Cremonese have only managed two wins in their last six matches in all competitions. Their attack has sputtered with an average of 0.83 goals scored per match, while conceding at the same rate. Recent home matches are no remedy either, with the side netting just one goal per home game and conceding 1.67 on average.

Cagliari mirror that narrative; over their last six, they have registered two wins, two draws, and two defeats. Offensively, they’ve done slightly better with 1.17 scored per match, but their rear guard has been vulnerable, conceding at the same rate. Their average possession hovers at 46% away from home, and total shots per match stands at 9.83, suggesting they are far from passive even when not in front of their own supporters.

The visitors’ squad is especially light due to a wave of injuries and absences. Cagliari will be without Michael Folorunsho, Joseph Liteta, Andrea Belotti, Yerry Mina, Zito Luvumbo, Mattia Felici, and Juan Rodríguez for this match. Cremonese, for their part, are missing Warren Bondo and Daniel Frey.
Considering both recent lineups and the sidelined lists, team selections are set to be influenced. Here are the most probable starting lineups in their usual systems:
Midfielders: Giuseppe Pezzella, Tommaso Barbieri, Dennis Johnsen, Alberto Grassi, Martín Payero
Midfielders: Marco Palestra, Michel Adopo, Matteo Prati, Luca Mazzitelli, Alessandro Deiola

All signs point toward another closely fought encounter. Cremonese’s home resilience is notable, but their inability to turn draws into wins may prove problematic. Cagliari arrive depleted, especially in attack, but retain enough in midfield and defense to make this a balanced contest.

Forebet’s algorithm leans towards Cagliari, assigning a 41% probability to the away side collecting all three points. That misses much between these teams statistically and tactically, with the likelihood of another low-scoring and hard-fought occasion taking center stage. Margins will be fine, just as they were in their last meeting.
Torino Eye Home Surge as Udinese Seek Turnaround at Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino
Lazio Looking to Break Draw Streak as Fiorentina Search for Improvement at Stadio Olimpico
Qadisiya Khubar haven't lost a match in 16 of their last 19 matches in Professional League
Their last 4 games in the Stars League have seen Al Sadd SC win by 2 or more goals
A goalless streak consisting of 4 matches has marked the Serie A campaign of Cremonese
Negele Arsi Ketema have kept a clean sheet in all of their last 3 Premier League games

previewParagraphs: Milan welcome Genoa to Stadio Giuseppe Meazza, aiming to solidify their position near the top of the Serie A standings. While Milan have shown consistency in recent matches, Genoa continue to search for answers to end their poor run of form.

In past encounters between these clubs at the San Siro, Milan have enjoyed a notably positive record. Out of their last 10 home clashes with Genoa, Milan have notched 5 victories, with 4 finishing level and only 1 ending in defeat. That recent dominance is echoed in the overall form of the Rossoneri, both in this season's Serie A and across all competitions.

Currently, Milan sit second in the Serie A, with an impressive 11 wins, 5 draws and just a single loss from 17 matches. They have averaged 1.65 goals per match while conceding just 0.76, a testament to their balanced approach under coach Massimiliano Allegri.

Delving into recent form, Milan have taken 3 wins from their last 6 outings, drawing once and losing twice, while scoring an average of 1.5 goals and conceding only 1.17 per match. Their performances at home have been particularly solid: in their last 3 fixtures at the Giuseppe Meazza, the Rossoneri are undefeated, with two wins and a draw, averaging 2 goals scored and conceding less than one per game.

Trends from Milan's larger sample of home performances also provide hints about this fixture. In their last 20 home matches in Serie A, Milan are undefeated in 85% of contests and have won 55%. Their defensive resilience is equally highlighted by a 43% clean sheet rate over the last 40 home league matches.

In direct contrast, Genoa are battling at the wrong end of the table. With 18 games played, they have managed just 3 wins and 6 draws, suffering defeat on 9 occasions. That negative goal difference currently stands at minus 10, with 18 goals scored and 28 conceded.

The recent form for Genoa does little to inspire confidence. Over their past 6 matches, they have collected just one win and one draw while losing 4. Their average goals scored per match is merely 0.83, while they have let in 2 per game, and their shots and possession metrics suggest ongoing struggles to control proceedings.

Zooming out further reveals that Genoa are winless in 5 of their last 6 matches. Their away day woes are even more telling: Genoa have failed to win in 17 of their last 20 matches on the road in all competitions. In league play, they have gone without victory in 12 of their last 15, losing 50% of their last 28 matches domestically.

Looking at key personnel, Milan are without Santiago Gimenez and Christopher Nkunku, both sidelined due to ankle issues. Genoa's Jean Onana is unavailable while away with his national team. Milan may alter their attack slightly, but their depth and blend of youth and experience should help mitigate the absences.
Midfielders: Ruben Loftus-Cheek, Adrien Rabiot, Luka Modrić, Davide Bartesaghi, Alexis Saelemaekers
Midfielders: Brooke Norton-Cuffy, Aarón Martín, Ruslan Malinovskyi, Morten Frendrup, Mikael Egill Ellertsson

With confidence high in Milan's camp and Genoa still winless in 5 of their last 6, the hosts look set to take all three points. Most indicators lean heavily in favor of Milan, with the prediction giving them a 62% probability of victory, likely by a margin such as 2-1 given both sides' scoring trends.
The meeting offers a prime opportunity for Milan to showcase their recent strength and for Genoa to attempt to turn the tide on a difficult run.

previewParagraphs: The Goffertstadion will set the stage for an intriguing Eredivisie clash as high-flying Nijmegen look to continue their strong run with Utrecht hoping to stabilize their form. Both sides bring distinct trends into the contest, and recent history offers insights into how this battle might unfold.

Nijmegen have put together an impressive string of results in their last six outings, securing four wins and drawing twice, while keeping their loss column untouched. Over this period, they have averaged nearly three goals per match, showing attacking prowess balanced by a defense conceding just under two. At home, they have won two and drawn one of their last three, scoring 2.33 per match and conceding just one.

Utrecht’s recent form tells a different story. In their last six, they have managed only one win alongside three draws and two defeats, scoring an average of 1.33 and conceding by the same measure. On the road, their ability to grind out points is visible, with a pattern of draws but not enough victories to climb the table.

The last three encounters between these teams have tipped slightly in Utrecht’s favor, with Nijmegen managing one victory while Utrecht have claimed the other two. However, the close nature and fluctuating outcomes serve as a reminder that previous meetings have been tight affairs.

After 17 league matches, Nijmegen find themselves well-placed in fourth with 8 wins, 5 draws, and 4 losses. Their tally of 43 goals—an average of 2.53 per game—shows the team’s attacking identity under Rogier Meijer. They have conceded 29, resulting in a strong +14 goal difference.

Utrecht sit eighth with a much more modest record: 6 wins, 5 draws, and 6 losses. They average 1.65 goals scored and have conceded 1.35 per match, for a goal difference of +5 after 17 played. Their campaign has included patches of resilience but also long spells without wins.

Nijmegen’s main trends speak of a side difficult to beat. They have been undefeated in 16 of their last 20 matches across all competitions, and bring a 7 match undefeated run into this fixture. At home, they are even more formidable—20 games unbeaten in their last 25. Additionally, there is a positive record when winning by two or more goals, which has occurred in 39% of their last 23 matches.

Utrecht’s story is less positive, as they have not secured a win in 16 of their past 20 matches across all competitions. Draws have featured prominently, with 5 in their last 10. Away from home, they have drawn in half of their last six but have gone winless in 9 out of 11—highlighting their lack of an away breakthrough.

previewParagraphs: Werder Bremen return to Weserstadion seeking answers against a high-flying Hoffenheim side. Both teams are set for an intense Bundesliga contest, but recent data highlights just how sizeable Bremen’s challenge will be on 10 January 2026.

This fixture carries a particular sense of urgency for Werder Bremen, who have found it difficult to gain the upper hand against Hoffenheim in recent encounters. In their last five home meetings with Hoffenheim, Bremen have managed just a single draw and suffered defeat four times, with no wins to show for their efforts.

That troublesome trend is mirrored in Bremen’s overall recent form. The hosts have won only one of their past six league matches, drawn two, and lost three, scoring an average of just 0.83 goals per match while allowing 1.83 at the other end. Offensively, Bremen have averaged 13.5 shots per match, but only 3.83 of those have been on target. Their possession numbers have also struggled to break the 50% barrier in this stretch.

Even at home, Bremen’s output has been inconsistent. Within their last three home games, Bremen have registered a solitary win, one draw, and one loss, with an average of one goal scored versus two conceded. Shots per match rise to 15.33 at Weserstadion, but the increase in scoring chances hasn’t translated into notable results.

Recent trends illustrate that Bremen are experiencing a difficult patch, as they have gone winless in their last five league matches. Over a slightly longer lens, six of their last seven ended without a victory. Despite these results, there is a glimmer of resilience; 82% of their last 11 home matches have been undefeated, and they have secured three victories in their previous six at Weserstadion.

In contrast, Hoffenheim’s form signals clear momentum. Across their last six matches in all competitions, Hoffenheim have three wins, two draws, and a single loss, averaging a notably higher 1.83 goals scored per match while conceding just 0.83. Their approach stresses ball retention, with 55.5% average possession and a slightly lower shot count than Bremen but with clinical finishing.

Hoffenheim’s away record further strengthens their prospects. In their last 13 away games, the team has been undefeated in 11, showing a real ability to secure results on the road. Additionally, they have drawn 50% of their last 12 away matches and won half of their last 10 away outings. Hoffenheim’s trend of winning by two or more goals (42% in their last 12 matches in all competitions) adds another layer of threat.

A glance at the Bundesliga table underscores Hoffenheim’s positive trajectory, sitting 5th with 29 goals scored and a healthy +9 goal difference from 15 matches (8 wins, 3 draws, 4 losses). Bremen, meanwhile, occupy the 10th spot. Their goal differential, at -10 with 28 conceded and only 18 scored from 15 games, underlines their defensive vulnerabilities and attacking inconsistency.

Managers Horst Steffen and Christian Ilzer have typically stuck with tried-and-true systems in recent matches, with Bremen most often lining up in a 4-2-3-1 formation, and Hoffenheim balancing between 4-2-2-2 and 4-4-2 set-ups. Neither side reports any significant absentees, allowing both coaches to deploy their preferred lineups.
Midfielders: Senne Lynen, Jens Stage, Cameron Puertas, Romano Schmid, Marco Grüll

According to analytics, a draw emerges as the most likely result, with a 39% chance and a prediction of a 1-1 final score line. Bremen’s lack of wins in 6 of their last 7 matches contrasts with Hoffenheim’s strong record, undefeated in 11 of their last 13 away games, leaving little room for error for the hosts.

Given Bremen’s home inconsistencies and Hoffenheim’s impressive away consistency, the numbers point to a tight contest, where discipline and efficiency in both penalty areas could ultimately define the outcome.

previewParagraphs: Union Berlin prepare to face Mainz at Stadion An der Alten Försterei with both sides seeking turning points for their Bundesliga campaigns. Union are looking to consolidate a midtable spot, while Mainz desperately need points to climb off the foot of the table. Both managers have crucial choices to make with personnel and tactics, and recent meetings suggest a competitive, tactical contest awaits.

Union Berlin’s recent run has been mixed. In their last six matches, they have won three and lost three, averaging 1.5 goals per game while conceding the same. Their performance at home has also been patchy, with just one win from the last three home matches and two defeats, scoring and conceding an average of two goals per match.

Mainz, on the other hand, continue to grapple with poor form. They have won only once in their last six, drawn three, and lost two, scoring an average of just 0.83 goals per game while conceding 1.33. Their away performances reflect broader problems, as they have failed to secure a win in 82% of their last 11 away matches in all competitions.

The head-to-head record offers little comfort for Mainz. Across the last 10 encounters, Union Berlin have emerged victorious six times, while Mainz have managed just a single win, with the remaining three ending in draws. Union’s dominance is further underlined by their overall edge across the last 20 meetings.
Looking more closely at Union’s recent home matches against Mainz, there’s a clear advantage: Union have won by a margin of two or more goals in 50% of the last six home encounters in this fixture.

Union hold 8th place after 15 matches, having won six, drawn three, and lost six, with a negative goal difference of minus three. They average 1.33 goals per game, but have conceded more often than they might like.

Mainz sit at the bottom in 18th with just one win all season from 15 games, five draws, and nine losses. Their struggle offensively is signaled by only 13 goals scored and a leaky defense, conceding 26. Their goal difference stands at minus 13.

Union’s last six matches in all competitions feature a perfectly balanced outcome—three wins and three losses, but their home form is showing signs of stress. Five of their last six home matches in all competitions have ended without victory. However, they have avoided defeat in five of their last six Bundesliga home games, suggesting a greater stubbornness on their own turf in league matches.

Mainz are currently winless in 13 of their last 16 matches across all competitions, and they have failed to win in 24 of their last 30 Bundesliga outings—sobering figures by any standard. The visitors have drawn 50% of their last eight Bundesliga games, but failing to convert draws into wins is costly. Notably, Mainz have not won any of their last 12 home matches in the Bundesliga but take a four-game undefeated streak in all competitions into this fixture, largely built on draws.

previewParagraphs: The Bundesliga resumes at Europa-Park Stadion as Freiburg prepares to host Hamburger SV. With both teams aiming to improve their mid-table positions, recent data strongly points toward a compelling encounter.

Freiburg enters this fixture with a favorable historical record against Hamburger SV, having won 3, drawn 2, and lost 1 in their last 6 meetings. This positive trend will surely give Julian Schuster’s side a boost.

Recent league form also tilts the scales toward Freiburg. Over their last 6 matches, they have secured 4 wins, 1 draw, and suffered just 1 defeat. With an average of 2.17 goals scored and only 1 conceded per match, Freiburg’s balance between attack and defense has been a key driver this season.

Home performances have been especially impressive. Across their last 3 matches at Europa-Park Stadion, Freiburg are unbeaten with 2 wins and 1 draw, conceding just 0.33 goals per game while producing an average of 20 total shots and dominated possession at 56%.

Much of this consistency stems from a stable lineup and tactical flexibility. Expect Freiburg to line up in their familiar 4-2-3-1 formation. Based on recent selections and squad health, the likely starting eleven should be:
Midfielders: Maximilian Eggestein, Patrick Osterhage, Philipp Treu, Yuito Suzuki, Johan Manzambi

Hamburger SV, on the other hand, come into this game in the midst of a patchy run. In their last 6 outings, Merlin Polzin’s team has won just twice, drawing 2 and losing 2 while averaging 1.17 goals scored and 1.5 conceded per match. Their struggles are even more pronounced on the road, where they’ve lost all of their last 3 away games, managed only 0.67 goals and conceded a worrying average of 3 per match.

Examining the trends over a larger sample, Hamburger SV have found it difficult to get results away from home. They have failed to win in 83% of their last 12 away matches across all competitions and suffered losses in 6 of those games. Additionally, they have lost by 2 or more goals in 43% of their last 7 away fixtures, reflecting ongoing defensive vulnerabilities.
The likely formation for Hamburger SV is the 3-4-3 they’ve favored recently, and their probable starting lineup looks like this:
Midfielders: Bakery Jatta, Albert Sambi Lokonga, Nicolai Remberg, Aboubaka Soumahoro

Considering league position after 15 matches, Freiburg sit 9th, boasting 5 wins, 5 draws, and 5 losses, with a nearly even goal difference. Hamburger SV are 13th, with 4 wins, 4 draws, and 7 losses while carrying a minus-9 goal differential. These standings reflect broader season trends, with Freiburg generally outperforming their guests.

In longer-term trends, Freiburg have collected 16 wins from their last 30 matches in all competitions and managed to remain undefeated in 24 of those fixtures. The home side has kept clean sheets in 40% of their last 10 Bundesliga home games and won by a margin of 2 or more goals in 40% of those as well.

The predictive model supports a Freiburg win at 42% probability, suggesting the home team’s solid form at Europa-Park Stadion could once again prove decisive. The algorithm forecasts a 3-1 result, aligning with Freiburg’s steady attacking output and Hamburger SV’s ongoing defensive frailties.

Overall, the metrics heavily favor Freiburg, whose consistent performances and reliable home record provide the foundation for a likely victory against a Hamburger SV side still seeking answers on their away travels.
